meanings.definition: Lacking or showing a lack of good judgment; unwise
meanings.sent1: It was injudicious to go out without an umbrella in the pouring rain.
meanings.sent2: She made an injudicious decision by quitting her job without a backup plan.
meanings.sent3: The injudicious squirrel thought it could outsmart the cat by stealing its food.
meanings.sent4: His injudicious investment in the failing company drained his savings.
meanings.sent5: The injudicious move of leaving the car unlocked led to it being stolen.

meanings.sent1: It was injudicious of him to share the secret with everyone in the office.
meanings.sent2: The injudicious comments he made during the meeting offended many people.
meanings.sent3: The injudicious puppy couldn't resist chewing on the expensive shoes.
meanings.sent4: Her injudicious behavior at the party embarrassed her friends.
meanings.sent5: The injudicious use of fireworks in a dry field caused a dangerous fire.
